definition: oath/pledge/union/to ally/league, a subdivision corresponding to prefecture in Inner Mongolia

sentences.english: One was the discovery by Allied troops of the German death camps.
sentences.chinese: 一个是发现由德国死亡集中营盟军部队。

sentences.english: But there were signs of disagreement among the allies in Paris.
sentences.chinese: 但是有迹象表明在巴黎时盟军中存在分歧。

sentences.english: And that's how Allied mathletes helped win the war.
sentences.chinese: 盟军的数学梦之队就这样助他们赢得了二战胜利。

sentences.english: No, the Allies don't have any Gap Generators in Red Alert 3.
sentences.chinese: 不在了，盟军不会有电子干扰器。

sentences.english: Allied forces were attacking from the west.
The ally of the working class was the peasantry.
sentences.chinese: 工人阶级的同盟军是农民阶级。

sentences.english: And he ordered his troops from nearby areas to join the fight and stop the Allied force.
sentences.chinese: 他下令他的部队从附近地区参加战斗和停止盟军部队。

sentences.english: On May 7-8, Tunis and Bizerte are captured.
sentences.chinese: 五月7至8日，突尼斯和比塞大被盟军攻占。

sentences.english: The Allies take heavy casualties and eventually get stalled at the Belgian border.
sentences.chinese: 盟军在霸王行动中伤亡惨重，最终停在比利时边境。

sentences.english: In Normandy, the Allies secured absolute command of both the air and sea.
sentences.chinese: 在诺曼底，盟军已经牢牢地掌握了制海权和制空权。

sentences.english: They were better protected than the Allied troops on the beaches.
sentences.chinese: 他们是更好的保护比在海滩上的盟军部队。

sentences.english: Many Australians fought as volunteers on the Allied side.
sentences.chinese: 许多澳大利亚人作为志愿兵与盟军一起战斗。

sentences.english: This picture shows Allied troops waiting for evacuation from the beaches at Dunkirk.
sentences.chinese: 这张照片显示盟军准备从敦刻尔克的滩头撤退。

sentences.english: Players can't put more than fatal damage on an ally this way.
sentences.chinese: 玩家不可以放置超过一个盟军生命值的伤害到其上。
盟军侦查员，吉佐，所罗门群岛，2002。

sentences.english: Tru- Lith blankets are available from Allied dealers throughout North America.
sentences.chinese: 超铀，利斯毯子可以从盟军经销商整个北美地区。

definition: Allies/entente (i.e. Western powers allied to China in WW1)
Stalingrad, former name of Volvograd 伏爾加格勒|伏尔加格勒 (1925-1961)
expeditionary force/army on a distant expedition
Pacific War between Japan and the US, 1941-1945

Battle of Stalingrad (1942-1943), decisive battle of Second World War and one of the bloodiest battles in history, when the Germans failed to take Stalingrad, were then trapped and destroyed by Soviet forces
pinyin: Si1 da4 lin2 ge2 le4 Zhan4 yi4
